etymology.description: 外(outside) + 滩/灘(sandbank; shoal) = outer riverbank → the Bund.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “outer sandbank,” originally the riverbank outside Shanghai’s old city wall. Now a proper noun for the famous waterfront along the Huangpu River.
etymology.simplification: 灘 → 滩 by simplifying the phonetic 難 to 难 under the water radical, reducing strokes while keeping the water semantic.

examples.chinese: 我们晚上去外滩看夜景(我們晚上去外灘看夜景)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen wǎnshang qù Wàitān kàn yèjǐng.
examples.english: We’re going to the Bund at night to see the city lights.

examples.chinese: 外滩沿着黄浦江(外灘沿著黃浦江)，有很多历史建筑(有很多歷史建築)。
examples.pinyin: Wàitān yánzhe Huángpǔ Jiāng, yǒu hěn duō lìshǐ jiànzhù.
examples.english: The Bund runs along the Huangpu River and has many historic buildings.

examples.chinese: 在外滩可以乘坐游船(在外灘可以乘坐遊船)，俯瞰浦东的天际线(俯瞰浦東的天際線)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Wàitān kěyǐ chéngzuò yóuchuán, fǔkàn Pǔdōng de tiānjìxiàn.
examples.english: At the Bund you can take a cruise and look over the Pudong skyline.
